body:
Hi @mehdijk,

Do you talk about the bootclasspath argument in JDT? Because, we don't have this kind of argument in `SpoonCompiler`. You can specify [your classpath](https://github.com/INRIA/spoon/blob/master/src/main/java/spoon/SpoonModelBuilder.java#L212) but not a specific classpath at the boot of the compilation.

Hi dear @GerardPaligot 
Yes. I have problem at the building model from old source codes. For example some interfaces in java.sql package are changed and when I compile them with spoon compiler it produces error that some methods were not implemented. is there a way to solve this problem?
What is the Java version used to write the old source codes?

> Change the Java compliance level of Spoon

This solution should be the best one.
Yes but that does not work for API change, which is the issue of mehdijk

It's complicate because you need to add "--bootclaspath [value]" in args at this line: https://github.com/INRIA/spoon/blob/master/src/main/java/spoon/support/compiler/jdt/JDTBasedSpoonCompiler.java#L212. 

By the way: you can change the JDK used by Eclipse in the project properties or change the JRE in the "Run Configurations"

Dear @tdurieux 
I checked also with JDK 6 and I was faced with the same error. I think my test-case  program class which uses java.sql  is only compatible with java 5. However I will try the difficult way. Thanks @tdurieux  and @GerardPaligot

issue.title: feat(compiler): Allows developers to specify their parameters.

repository.name: spoon
repository.description: Spoon is a metaprogramming library to analyze and transform Java source code. :spoon: is made with :heart:, :beers: and :sparkles:. It parses source files to build a well-designed AST with powerful analysis and transformation API.
